support_summary: ATXN3 interacts with the E3/E4 ubiquitin ligase PRPF19 (pre-mRNA processing factor 19), a component of the spliceosome that also plays a role in the DNA damage response.

functions.cellular_process: The E3 ubiquitin ligase PRPF19 (pre-mRNA processing factor 19) interacts with polyglutamine-expanded mutant ATXN3, leading to its poly-ubiquitination and subsequent degradation by the proteasome.
functions.effect_description: By targeting mutant ATXN3 for degradation, PRPF19 reduces the levels of the toxic protein. Overexpression of PRPF19 has been shown to alleviate cytotoxicity and suppress neurodegeneration in cellular and Drosophila models of Spinocerebellar Ataxia Type 3 (SCA3). This function is dependent on the nuclear localization and E3 ligase activity of PRPF19.
biological_consequence: PRPF19 binds to polyQ-expanded mutant ATXN3 in the nucleus → PRPF19, as an E3 ligase, catalyzes the poly-ubiquitination of mutant ATXN3 → Poly-ubiquitinated mutant ATXN3 is recognized and degraded by the proteasome → Cellular levels of toxic mutant ATXN3 are reduced → Cytotoxicity and neurodegeneration are suppressed
specific_effects: PRPF19 promotes the poly-ubiquitination and degradation of mutant ATXN3-polyQ protein.
Overexpression of PRPF19 reduces the protein level of expanded ATXN3 and ameliorates SCA3-related cytotoxicity.
The modulatory effect of PRPF19 on mutant ATXN3 is dependent on its nuclear localization.
Knockdown of PRPF19 leads to an increase in mutant ATXN3 levels and enhanced toxicity.

evidence.paper_title: A fine balance between Prpf19 and Exoc7 in achieving degradation of aggregated protein and suppression of cell death in spinocerebellar ataxia type 3
evidence.relevant_quote: In this study, we identified an E3 ligase, pre-mRNA processing factor 19 (Prpf19/prp19), that modulates expanded ataxin-3 (ATXN3-polyQ), disease protein of SCA3, induced neurodegeneration in both mammalian and Drosophila disease models. We further showed that Prpf19/prp19 promotes poly-ubiquitination and degradation of mutant ATXN3-polyQ protein.

mechanism: The E3 ubiquitin ligase PRPF19 (pre-mRNA processing factor 19) interacts with polyglutamine-expanded mutant ATXN3, leading to its poly-ubiquitination and subsequent degradation by the proteasome.
effect: By targeting mutant ATXN3 for degradation, PRPF19 reduces the levels of the toxic protein. Overexpression of PRPF19 has been shown to alleviate cytotoxicity and suppress neurodegeneration in cellular and Drosophila models of Spinocerebellar Ataxia Type 3 (SCA3). This function is dependent on the nuclear localization and E3 ligase activity of PRPF19.
summary: ATXN3 activates PRPF19 to modulate mutant atxn3 degradation, ultimately affecting cytotoxicity and neurodegeneration are suppressed.

evidence.paper_title: A fine balance between Prpf19 and Exoc7 in achieving degradation of aggregated protein and suppression of cell death in spinocerebellar ataxia type 3
evidence.relevant_quote: In this study, we identified an E3 ligase, pre-mRNA processing factor 19 (Prpf19/prp19), that modulates expanded ataxin-3 (ATXN3-polyQ), disease protein of SCA3, induced neurodegeneration in both mammalian and Drosophila disease models. We further showed that Prpf19/prp19 promotes poly-ubiquitination and degradation of mutant ATXN3-polyQ protein.
